text.__SUMMARY__: Polemon robustus, or the Zaire snake-eater, is a species of rear-fanged venomous snake in the family Atractaspididae. The species is endemic to Africa.
text.Geographic range: P. robustus is found in the Central African Republic and the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
text.Further reading: de Witte GF, Laurent RF (1947). "Revision d'un groupe de Colubridae africains: genres Calamelaps, Miodon, Aparallactus, et formes affines ". Mém. Mus. Roy. Hist. Nat. Belgique (sér. 2) 29: 1-134. (Miodon robustus, new species, p. 62). (in French).
